definition: to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
to shake/to flap/to vibrate/to resonate/to rise up with spirit/to rouse oneself
to shake/to flap/to vibrate/to resonate/to rise up with spirit/to rouse oneself
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
old variant of 詞|词[ci2]
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: I should be the last to reject such a loud statement.
sentences.chinese: 我是决不想反驳这样一个振振有词的声明的。
他表示了振振有词的抗议。

sentences.english: His voice rose with the conviction of his chapel speeches.
sentences.chinese: 他提高了嗓音，像在教堂里讲话一般振振有词。

definition: to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions/also written 振振有詞|振振有词
in the right and self-confident (idiom); bold and confident with justice on one's side/to have the courage of one's convictions/just and forceful
to twist words and force logic (idiom)/sophistry/loud rhetoric making up for fallacious argument/shoving false arguments down people's throats
to speak forcibly out of a sense of righteousness (idiom)
to boast shamelessly/to talk big
to have no sense of shame
variant of 憤憤不平|愤愤不平[fen4 fen4 bu4 ping2]
righteous indignation fills one's breast (idiom); to feel indignant at injustice
to feel indignant/to feel aggrieved
to quibble
immensely pleased with oneself (idiom)/proud/complacent
see 煞有介事[sha4 you3 jie4 shi4]
devotion to righteousness that inspires reverence (idiom)
to argue strenuously or with sophistry/to quibble
not to overlook, nor spare (idiom); unwilling to forgive/to treat severely without listening to excuses
immensely pleased with oneself (idiom)/proud/complacent
